plugins.name: md格式转设计稿 Markdown to Frame
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin’s UI and click the ‘Convert Markdown’ button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.


介绍

此插件允许用户将Markdown文本自动转换成完全结构化的Figma框架，增强设计工作流程和文档处理过程。


功能说明

插件解析Markdown语法，并创建相应的Figma框架和文本元素，支持标题、列表、加粗文本和水平规则。它确保所有内容都按照Markdown的结构进行视觉组织。


使用方法

只需在插件的用户界面中提供的文本区域中输入您的Markdown文本，然后点击“转换Markdown”按钮。格式化的内容将以结构化框架的形式出现在您当前的Figma文件中。


注意事项

确保在转换前所有文本都正确格式化为Markdown。框架宽度固定为500px，但高度将根据内容调整。

plugins.tagline: Transform Markdown into Structured Figma Frames

plugins.name: batchy
plugins.description:
batchy is a helper tool to make your exports more comfortable. Instead of just using the layer name and getting the layer size, you will now be able to write your own asset name dynamically with the help of export tokens and choosing between layer size or screen size for your assets.


Features

  1. dynamic asset names with several export tokens like: layers, date, file, scaling, index, user, top-level frame name,
  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
plugins.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

plugins.name: Variable Remapper
plugins.description:
OVERVIEW


The Variable Remapper is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline design system management by enabling seamless migration and remapping of variables between different libraries and collections. This tool is essential for teams managing complex design systems, migrating between libraries, or consolidating variable usage across projects.


CORE CAPABILITIES


Variable Remapping

The plugin provides comprehensive bulk variable migration capabilities, automatically remapping variables from one library to another across entire design systems. The intelligent name matching system matches variables between source and target libraries based on name similarity, reducing manual configuration requirements.

Users can exercise precise scope control by choosing to remap variables across selected objects only, the current page, or all pages in the document. Additionally, collection-specific remapping allows filtering to specific variable collections for granular control over migration processes.


Variable Analysis and Mapping

The system offers comprehensive variable listing functionality to scan and catalog all variable bindings throughout designs. The detailed view presents every variable binding with complete contextual information, including node names and types, bound properties such as fills, strokes, effects, and dimensions, current variable names and sources, plus complete library and collection information.

The grouped view consolidates similar variable bindings for streamlined bulk management operations, while the interactive mapping table enables manual specification of target variables for precise control over remapping processes.


Library Management

The plugin provides robust multi-library support, working seamlessly with local variables in current files, team library variables, and remote libraries. Automatic library detection identifies variable sources and displays comprehensive library information throughout the interface.

Users can browse through variable collections with detailed counts and metadata, supported by real-time loading of library collections and variables for immediate access to current information.


KEY FEATURES


Precision Control

The plugin supports comprehensive property-level binding across all Figma variable binding types, including color variables for fills and strokes, dimension variables for width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight, effect variables for opacity, rotation, and positioning, and boolean variables for visibility controls.

Advanced array property support handles complex bindings such as multiple fills or effects, while safe remapping functionality validates target variables before applying changes to ensure data integrity throughout the migration process.


Advanced Analysis

The binding discovery system automatically identifies all variable bindings across complex node hierarchies, providing complete visibility into variable usage patterns. Source attribution functionality shows exactly where each variable originates, whether from the current file, specific team library names, or remote libraries.

Collection context displays variable collection names for improved organization and understanding of variable relationships throughout the design system.


User Experience

The tabbed interface provides clean separation between remapping and analysis functions, enabling focused workflows for different use cases. Real-time feedback includes loading states, progress indicators, and detailed status messages to keep users informed throughout operations.

Comprehensive error handling delivers actionable feedback when issues arise, while the modern user interface utilizes Figma-native styling with responsive design principles for seamless integration with existing workflows.


USE CASES


Design System Migration

Organizations can migrate from deprecated variable libraries to updated versions, consolidate multiple libraries into a single source of truth, and update variable references when reorganizing design systems. This capability is essential for maintaining consistency during design system evolution and reducing technical debt.


Theme Management

Teams can efficiently switch between light and dark theme variables, apply brand-specific variable sets across different product lines, and test various variable configurations during design exploration phases. This functionality supports rapid iteration and brand consistency maintenance.


Cleanup and Optimization

The plugin enables identification of unused or orphaned variable bindings, standardization of variable usage across teams, and comprehensive auditing of variable implementation across large-scale projects. These capabilities support design system hygiene and optimization efforts.


Workflow Automation

Organizations can batch update variable references during design system updates, streamline handoff processes between design and development teams, and maintain consistency across multiple Figma files. This automation reduces manual work and minimizes human error in variable management processes.
plugins.tagline: Streamline design system by bulk remapping variables across libraries, pages, and components.

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
🧩 Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes — including all their children — with just a click.


✨ Features


- 🔍 Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- 🧾 Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ✅ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- 🌳 Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- 💾 Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ⚡️ Fast, no setup, no code required


---


🚀 How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click → Plugins → Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `✨ Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `🔧 Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


📦 Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


🔐 Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


🧠 Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


👨‍💻 Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children — quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: FontMaster - Switch every font in one click
plugins.description:
✨ Take control of your typography in Figma — instantly.


FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


🛠️ How to Use

  1. Run the plugin – FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts – View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font – Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes – Click “Apply” and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


✅ Why Use FontSwap?

  1. Detects all fonts in seconds
  2. Bulk replace fonts with one click
  3. Perfect for design clean-up, brand updates, and system consistency
  4. Saves time on every project

plugins.name: Syntax Highlighter
plugins.description:
How to use


Applying syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a code snippet.
  2. Choose a programming language, if required (the plugin will try to identify the language automatically).
  3. Choose a theme.
  4. Toggle include background and line numbers, if required.
  5. Click Apply.


Clearing syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a formatted code snippet.
  2. Click the Clear formatting button.


Adding custom Visual Studio themes


  1. Open Visual Studio Code.
  2. Install the desired color theme and switch to the theme in Visual Studio Code.
  3. Press Ctrl + Shift + P and run Developer: Generate Color Theme from current settings.
  4. Select the file's contents and copy.
  5. Open the Figma plugin and press the Create a new theme button.
  6. Paste into the Create a new theme dialog and click Save.


Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.

accepted.name: Microsoft
accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

plugins.tagline: Apply syntax highlighting colors to code snippets.

plugins.name: Yet Another Design Linter
plugins.description:
✨ Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs—fast.


🚀 Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides—they're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


🔍 What it does:

• Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography—flags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


• Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


• Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


• Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


• Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


• Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


• Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


• Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


• Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


• Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


• Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion—no guessing.


• Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


🚦 It detects:

✅ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

✅ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

✅ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

✅ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

✅ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

✅ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

✅ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

✅ Nested components causing potential performance issues

✅ Issues in hidden or locked layers (configurable)


🎨 How it works:

1. Run the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Review errors categorized by type (Core Design, Spacing & Layout, Visual Properties, Typography, Variable Management, Component Structure).

3. Apply auto-suggestions with one click or fix issues manually.

4. Configure settings to match your team's workflow and design system.


💡 Who it's for:

• Designers who care about clean, token-driven files

• Teams enforcing scalable, maintainable design systems

• Design system managers ensuring consistency across projects

• Developers who need structured, handoff-ready designs

• Teams transitioning to variable-based design workflows


🎯 Perfect for:

• Design system audits and cleanup

• Onboarding new team members to design standards

• Pre-handoff quality checks

• Maintaining design token consistency at scale


Made with ❤️ for the Adtraction design team by Jonatan D. Bjerrekær.


YADL: Keep your Figma files clean, scalable, and system-perfect—automatically.
plugins.tagline: Keep your Figma files clean, consistent, and design-system perfect—automatically.

plugins.name: Frame Navigator
plugins.description:
🧭 FrameNavigator


Effortlessly navigate large and complex Figma files with FrameNavigator — a floating Table of Contents plugin that helps you stay organized and move between frames in a single click.


✨ Key Features


- Quick Navigation

Instantly jump to any frame from a floating panel that stays visible while you work.


- Custom Frame Registration

Select frames directly on the canvas and add them to your TOC with a simple "+" button.


- Group Organization

Organize your frames into custom groups for better structure and clarity—perfect for managing multiple screens.


- Flexible Panel Sizes

Choose between default, compact, and full views to match your workflow and screen space.


---


🛠 How It Works


  1. Register a Frame: Select a frame on the Figma canvas and click the `+` button in the plugin to add it to the TOC.
  2. Create a Group: Hover over ungrouped frames in the TOC and click the appearing checkbox to select them. Then click the Create Group button at the top of the panel to group them.
  3. Add to Existing Group: Select a group first, then select a new frame on the canvas and click `+` to add the frame into that group.
  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. ⚠️ Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

plugins.name: RTL智能适配助手 RTL Auto Adapt Helper
plugins.description:
介绍

本插件可帮助设计师一键启用或关闭组件的“阿语”属性，用于快速适配阿拉伯语等 RTL（从右至左）语言界面。支持自动识别并批量设置所选节点及其子组件的变量值，提高国际化效率。


功能说明

  1. 自动查找所选组件中的“阿语”变量属性
  2. 一键切换阿语属性值为 on 或 off
  3. 实时统计处理成功和失败的组件数量
  4. 支持递归处理嵌套结构与实例组件


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 中选中一个或多个组件或画板
  2. 打开插件界面
  3. 点击“启用阿语模式”或“关闭阿语模式”按钮
  4. 查看统计信息，确认处理结果


注意事项

  1. 插件仅处理存在“阿语”变量属性的组件
  2. 若组件未设置该属性，将不会被修改
  3. 暂不支持自动创建属性，请先在组件中配置好“阿语”变量


Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click “Enable Arabic Mode” or “Disable Arabic Mode”
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties — please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: Smart Arabic mode toggle for RTL-friendly components

plugins.name: Change Variable Descriptions
plugins.description:
Tired of manually updating each Figma variable’s description? This plugin streamlines the process by allowing you to update all variable descriptions simultaneously using a CSV file. This means you can ensure your design system stays consistent and well-documented—without the hassle of repetitive edits.


How It Works:


•Prepare Your CSV: Create a CSV file with the format: token_name,description. Ensure each variable name in your CSV matches exactly (1:1) with the ones in Figma; the plugin is sensitive to misspellings and will skip any mismatches.

•Select Variable Collection(s): Choose one or multiple variable collections based on your CSV file. (Recommendation: create a separate CSV for each collection.)

•Preview Changes: Review the highlighted changes in a table before applying them, ensuring accuracy and control over the update process.

•Apply Updates: With just a few clicks, update all selected variable descriptions in your Figma design system.


Streamline your design documentation, avoid manual errors, and keep your design tokens up-to-date effortlessly!
plugins.tagline: Simplify workflow: Update variable descriptions in one click

plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!

plugins.description:
Instantly view all fonts used in your selection, selectively replace specific font families, and preserve font weights and styles when switching to new fonts. Whether you're cleaning up inconsistent typography, updating your brand, or exploring new typefaces, Font Replacer makes the process fast, intuitive, and reliable.


  1. See all fonts in your selection at a glance
  2. Replace one or multiple font families with a single click
  3. Maintains font weights/styles (e.g., Bold, Italic) when switching families
  4. Handles mixed-font text layers and nested groups
  5. Smart fallbacks ensure your text always looks great
  6. Clean, modern UI with loading indicators for large selections

plugins.name: 批量字号行高对齐
plugins.description:
## 🎯 核心功能

- **智能识别模式**：自动区分单行文本和段落文本，分别应用最适合的行高倍数

- **统一行高模式**：为所有选中文本应用相同的行高倍数，精确控制排版节奏

- **批量处理**：支持选中 Frame、Group 等容器，一键处理内部所有文本图层


## ✨ 使用场景

- 快速统一设计稿中的文字行高

- 优化阅读体验，单行标题紧凑，段落文本舒适

- 批量调整多个页面的文字排版


## 🔧 默认设置

- **单行文本**：1.0 倍（紧凑排版）

- **段落文本**：1.68 倍（黄金比例，舒适阅读）

- **支持自定义调整**：0.1–5 倍


## 🆕 更新日志 v2.0

- 新增智能识别功能，自动区分单行和段落文本

- 新增统一行高模式，满足不同设计需求

- 优化 UI 界面，操作更直观

- 支持自定义行高倍数（0.1–5 倍）

- 行高计算采用向下取整，确保像素完美对齐


---


## 🎯 Core Features

- **Smart Detection Mode**: Automatically distinguishes between single-line and paragraph text, applying the optimal line height multiplier for each.

- **Uniform Line Height Mode**: Applies the same line height multiplier to all selected text layers for precise typographic control.

- **Batch Processing**: Supports selection of Frames, Groups, and other containers to apply changes to all nested text layers in one click.


## ✨ Use Cases

- Quickly unify text line height across your design

- Improve readability: tighter single-line headings, more breathable paragraph spacing

- Batch-adjust text layouts across multiple pages


## 🔧 Default Settings

- **Single-line text**: 1.0× (compact layout)

- **Paragraph text**: 1.68× (golden ratio for comfortable reading)

- **Supports custom adjustment** from 0.1× to 5.0×


## 🆕 Update Log - v2.0

- Added smart detection for single-line vs. paragraph text

- Introduced uniform line height mode for consistent styling

- Improved UI for a more intuitive experience

- Custom line height range support (0.1×–5.0×)

- Line height calculation now uses floor rounding for pixel-perfect alignment
plugins.tagline: 批量字号行高对齐

plugins.name: Lokki - Comments Export
plugins.description:
Description

A plugin that allows you to turn Figma comments into Jira tasks with a couple of clicks.


Key features

- Export comments to selected Jira project

- Filter comments

- Merge multiple comments into one.

- Turn comment into sub-issue of the existing Jira issue.


How to use

When you run the plugin, it offers a simple 3 step onboarding screen explaining how things work.

  1. During the first run, we'll ask you to connect your plugin with your Jira.
  2. Next you need to generate personal token that allows you access your comments. This is mandatory for plugins operation since Figma do not provide direct access to comments with figma plugin tools.
  3. Select Jira project that you will use as default. You can change it later.
  4. That's it. You can select comments and export them to the Jira.


Sidenote

This is our first-ever plugin on Figma, and while things might not be ideal all at once, we are happy to hear your feedback, questions, and suggestions at dev@lokki.tools

Webpage: https://lokki.tools


Data Security & Network access

Our plugin does not save any remote counterpart, it means your data is only stored on your computer, inside your Figma editor. This applies to all of your data, tokes and comments except user identifier related to the premium status and subscription info.


About

- Idea by Kseniia Pashkovska & Oleksandr Drobinin

- Implementation by Oleksandr Drobinin
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma comments into Jira tasks instantly

plugins.name: ShadeSmith – AI Palette Generator
plugins.description:
ShadeSmith is a Figma plugin that helps designers and developers instantly create scalable color palettes from a single base color (500-level).

It automatically generates tints, shades, and tonal variations using intelligent color logic. Whether you’re working on a design system, branding kit, or just experimenting, ShadeSmith ensures visually consistent and WCAG-compliant palettes with every click.


✨ Features:

•Start from any hex/RGB/base color

•Instantly generate tints (100–400) and shades (600–900)

•Accessible contrast suggestions built-in

•Copy-ready output for Figma styles, Tailwind tokens, or CSS

•Customizable intensity and range sliders


Perfect for:

•Design systems

•Theming

•Light/dark mode variants

•Rapid prototyping

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


✨ Key Features:

•Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

•Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

•Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


📌 How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.
